name: Sky Folder
description:
"Do you know how stars are aligned?" asked him as he nestled around his blanket.

"Don't they being randomly scattered from a singularity?" I answered reluctantly while scrolling my phone. Ugh, another Covid news.
"Ah, the `big bang theory` then? Yes, that's quite interesting," His deep gaze made me glanced over my screen ,"but, have you heard about The Sky Folder?"
"The what now?"
"The one that fold the sky and neatly bring the stars to their own constellations." His hand trace the emptiness as if it weaved some invisible thread in the air.
"Pulling those humongous stars by itself?" I chuckled. Here we go again.
"Eh, worry not, The Sky Folder is bigger than that. It's next to gigantic-humongous creature, or thing, or something."
"Heh, then he'll knock over all the planet as he passed through," I put my head back on the pillow and close my eyes. The Sky Folder. Quite a catchy name of another made up creature from him.
"I met one when I was a kid," he sighed, "and no one believed me."
His sad eyes glistened in the dark. He's weird, I know. It's famous feature of him. But I like his weirdness. "Come on! Let's go the roof now!"
"Now?"
"Yes! I'll show you how The Sky Folder arrange the stars to put my name in the sky!" He jumped from the bed and pulled my hand
"Wait! My phone! Ghah! " And once again it dropped under our bed.
